column4: having a problem w/ upgrading to hoary:  seems xorg-driver-synaptics tries to overwrite /usr/bin/synclient, which is also in package xfree86-drive-synaptics.
and I can't get past that
yes, but it won't let me remove xfree86-driver-synaptics because of unmet dependancies, wants me to run apt-get -f install first
can you try using apt-get -f remove xfree86-driver-synaptics?
nm, removed ubuntu-desktop which was the one w/ the dependancy, and onward it goes
will have to put back those packages again tho
odd, I would have expected dist-upgrade to take care of that
yeah, ubuntu-desktop would be good to install
I was vorried it would take  a bunch of other stuff out when I removed it, but it didn't so it was ok :P
ubuntu-desktop is a "meta package" - it doesn't actually install anything itself, it just depends on a ton of other packages so they're installed
